column1: The Dwarves of Belegost were a people of Dwarves who dwelt in the city of Belegost
column2: the northernmost of the two great Dwarf-cities that stood in the Blue Mountains during the First Age.

column1: They had generally better relations with the Elves than their neighbors in Nogrod
column2: and were behind the building of Menegroth. The Dwarves of Belegost were friends to the Sindar and later allies of the Noldor of Beleriand. They first met the Noldor Elves near Rerir and a great friendship began between the two peoples; Maedhros once saved Lord Azaghâl from an Orcs-assault.
column3: p. 75 They joined the Union of Maedhros and fought bravely beside each other during the Nirnaeth Arnoediad
column4: where they lost their ruler Lord Azaghâl in battle to the dragon Glaurung.

column1: When the Dwarves of Nogrod assembled a great host of Dwarves to attack Doriath
column2: the Dwarves of Belegost tried to dissuade them from war
column3: but their brethren from Nogrod did not heed their advice. These dwarves went on to fight in the Battle of the Thousand Caves
column4: and later met their demise the Battle of Sarn Athrad. After this tragedy the Dwarves of Belegost started leaving for Moria
column5: for fear of reprisal from the Elves. There was much loathing between Elf and Dwarf from there on.

column1: Belegost was later ruined in the War of Wrath
column2: and most of the dwarves left for Khazad-dûm. Some stayed to build
column5: along with the remaining Dwarves of Nogrod. However
column6: Belegost seems to have been mostly abandoned.

column2: the Dwarves of Belegost were second only to the Dwarves of Nogrod. They learned many secrets in smithing from the Elves
column3: and Elves from the Dwarves. They created many weapons for the Elves when evil began to stir in Beleriand
column4: and the smiths of Belegost were the first to create linked ring mail.
